description: UEFA says it opened a disciplinary case for 'field invasions by supporters' at Nou Camp on Wednesday night. UEFA's disciplinary panel will judge the case on March 23.
title: Barcelona could be FINED for celebrating win over PSG
title_page: Barcelona could be FINED for celebrating win over PSG | Daily Mail Online
text:
Barcelona could be fined by UEFA after fans ran on the field to celebrate the Champions League win over Paris Saint-Germain.
UEFA says it opened a disciplinary case for 'field invasions by supporters' at Nou Camp on Wednesday.
UEFA's disciplinary panel will judge the case on Thursday, March 23.
Barcelona fans ran onto the pitch to celebrate their comeback against Paris Saint-Germain
UEFA opened a disciplinary case for the 'field invasions by supporters' on Wednesday night
Barcelona scored three times after the 87th minute to win 6-1 and complete a 6-5 aggregate victory to reach the quarter-finals.
A last-gasp double from Neymar and a Sergi Roberto goal ensured Barcelona crushed PSG's dreams on Wednesday night in Spain.
No team had overturned a 4-0 first-leg loss since the Champions League replaced the European Cup knockout format in 1992.
